Constant.Description: Fired when the (in rollback_event_param) player_id is connected

Constant.Name: rollback_synchronizing_with_peer
Constant.Description: Fired when the (in rollback_event_param) player_id is synchonizing

Constant.Name: rollback_synchronized_with_peer
Constant.Description: Fired when the (in rollback_event_param) player_id is done synchonizing

Constant.Name: rollback_disconnected_from_peer
Constant.Description: Fired when the (in rollback_event_param) player_id is disconnected

Constant.Name: rollback_game_interrupted
Constant.Description: Fired when the game is interrupted by a (in rollback_event_param) player_id

Constant.Name: rollback_game_resumed
Constant.Description: Fired when the game resumes after being interrupted by (in rollback_event_param) player_id

Constant.Name: rollback_game_full
Constant.Description: Fired when the game you're trying to join is already full

Constant.Name: rollback_game_info
Constant.Description: Fired when you receive back info about the game (in rollback_event_param) player_id and num_players

Constant.Name: rollback_connection_rejected
Constant.Description: Fired when connection attempt was rejected. The error can be caused by invalid token, mismatch in client versions, mismatch in protocol versions. Multiplayer session is closed automatically before event is fired

Constant.Name: rollback_protocol_rejected
Constant.Description: Fired when connection attempt was rejected. The error means that client uses obsolete version of the protocol. Before this event is fired GM will show an error message in the UI. Multiplayer session is closed automatically before event is fired

Constant.Name: rollback_end_game
Constant.Description: Fired when server wants clients to stop the game. Usually this event means that clients are in inconsistent state. Multiplayer session is closed automatically before event is fired

Constant.Name: rollback_chat_message
Constant.Description: Fired when you receive a chat message, including those sent by the local player (in rollback_event_param) message, from and to

Constant.Name: rollback_player_prefs
Constant.Description: Fired when you receive new preferences set by any of the players in the game, including those set by the local player (in rollback_event_param) preferences, and player_id

Constant.Name: rollback_high_latency
Constant.Description: Fired when the latency to the server is too high and it's impossible to run the game. Multiplayer session is closed automatically before event is fired

Constant.Name: rollback_connect_info
Constant.Description: Fired when you get info of where players should connect (in rollback_event_param) share_url

Constant.Name: rollback_connect_error
Constant.Description: Fired when you fail to connect to the backend

Constant.Name: audio_bus_main
Constant.Description: The main audio bus

Field.Name: name
Field.Description: This is the name of the sequence as a string and you can get or set this value as required. Note that sequences created using the function sequence_create() will not have a name and this will simply be an empty string "".

Field.Name: loopmode
Field.Description: This is the playback mode of the sequence object and can be get or set.

Field.Name: playbackSpeed
Field.Description: This specifies the playback speed of the sequence, which is interpreted as either frames-per-second or frames-per-game-frame depending on the playbackSpeedType (see below). You can get or set this value.

Field.Name: playbackSpeedType
Field.Description: This specifies how the playbackSpeed should be interpreted and you can get or set this value.

Field.Name: length
Field.Description: The length of the sequence in frames. You can get or set this value, but note that making a sequence shorter may cause issues if a sequence instance referencing this sequence has its playhead set to past the new length.

Field.Name: volume
Field.Description: This is a scalar value from 0 to 1 that is used to scale the volume of all audio tracks in the sequence. You can get or set this value and it will modify the global audio output for all tracks - for example, if you have an audio track with a volume of 0.8 and then set the sequence volume property to 0.5, the audio track will have a final volume of 0.4.

Field.Name: xorigin
Field.Description: This is the origin of the sequence along the X axis.

Field.Name: yorigin
Field.Description: This is the origin of the sequence along the Y axis.

Field.Name: messageEventKeyframes
Field.Description: This allows access to the message event keyframes for the sequence. You can get or set these message events, and when getting this property an array of keyframe structs is returned, and for setting the property you           should supply an array of keyframe structs. For more information, please see the page on Sequence Events and Moments.

Field.Name: momentKeyframes
Field.Description: This allows access to the moment event keyframes for the sequence. You can get or set these moment events, and when getting this property an array of keyframe structs is returned, and for setting the property you should supply           an array of keyframe structs. For more information, please see the page on Sequence Events and Moments.

Field.Name: tracks
Field.Description: This allows access to the list of asset tracks on the top level of the sequence. You can get or set this property, and when getting this property an array of track structs is returned, and for setting the property you should           supply an array of track structs. For more information, please see the section on Track Structs.

Field.Name: message
Field.Description: Short message for this exception.

Field.Name: longMessage
Field.Description: Long message for this exception.

Field.Name: script
Field.Description: Describes the script where this exception came from.

Field.Name: stacktrace
Field.Description: The stack frame that the exception was generated from.

Field.Name: bypass
Field.Description: Whether to bypass all effects and gain scaling of the bus.

Field.Name: gain
Field.Description: The output gain of the bus.

Field.Name: effects
Field.Description: The chain of audio effects on the bus.

Field.Name: attack
Field.Description: The response time to apply the effect.

Field.Name: bypass
Field.Description: Whether to bypass the effect.

Field.Name: cutoff
Field.Description: The cutoff frequency of the filter.

Field.Name: damp
Field.Description: The amount of higher frequency damping.

Field.Name: eq1
Field.Description: A peak EQ filter.

Field.Name: eq2
Field.Description: A peak EQ filter.

Field.Name: eq3
Field.Description: A peak EQ filter.

Field.Name: eq4
Field.Description: A peak EQ filter.

Field.Name: factor
Field.Description: The factor by which the signal is downsampled.

Field.Name: feedback
Field.Description: The proportion of the signal which is fed back into the delay line.

Field.Name: freq
Field.Description: The center frequency of the filter.

Field.Name: gain
Field.Description: The gain applied to the input signal.

Field.Name: hicut
Field.Description: A low-pass filter.

Field.Name: hishelf
Field.Description: A high-shelf filter.

Field.Name: ingain
Field.Description: The input gain scalar.

Field.Name: intensity
Field.Description: The propertion of the signal which is affected by the LFO.

Field.Name: locut
Field.Description: A high-pass filter.

Field.Name: loshelf
Field.Description: A low-shelf filter.

Field.Name: mix
Field.Description: The proportion of the affected signal to output.

Field.Name: offset
Field.Description: The proportion of the LFO period that the LFOs should be desynced by.

Field.Name: outgain
Field.Description: The output gain scalar.

Field.Name: q
Field.Description: The quality factor of the filter.

Field.Name: rate
Field.Description: The frequency of the modulating LFO.

Field.Name: ratio
Field.Description: The compression ratio.

Field.Name: release
Field.Description: The response time to stop applying the effect.

Field.Name: resolution
Field.Description: The bit depth at which the signal is resampled.

Field.Name: shape
Field.Description: The waveshape of the LFO.

Field.Name: size
Field.Description: The size of the space.

Field.Name: threshold
Field.Description: The gain threshold over which the effect is applied.

Field.Name: time
Field.Description: The duration of the delay.

Field.Name: type
Field.Description: The type of the effect.

Field.Name: width
Field.Description: The width of the whole tile set texture (in pixels).

Field.Name: height
Field.Description: The height of the whole tile set texture (in pixels).

Field.Name: texture
Field.Description: The texture ID.

Field.Name: tile_width
Field.Description: The width of a single tile (in pixels).

Field.Name: tile_height
Field.Description: The height of a single tile (in pixels).

Field.Name: tile_horizontal_separator
Field.Description: The number of pixels horizontally on each side of each tile (making the space between two tiles 2 * tile_horizontal_separator).

Field.Name: tile_vertical_separator
Field.Description: The number of pixels vertically on each side of each tile (making the space between two tiles 2 * tile_vertical_separator)

Field.Name: tile_columns
Field.Description: The number of columns on each row of the tile set.

Field.Name: tile_count
Field.Description: The number of tiles.

Field.Name: frame_count
Field.Description: The number of frames of animation per animation.

Field.Name: frame_length_ms
Field.Description: The number of milliseconds for frame animation.

Field.Name: frames
Field.Description: A struct containing all the animation frames. Each tile number has a key in the struct, each entry is an array of the frames to use (each array should be frame_count long).
